    • buildWordFrequencyMap

      public static Map<String,Integer> buildWordFrequencyMap(String emailBody)
      Builds a frequency map of words from the given email body. The method removes punctuation, converts all words to lowercase, and counts the occurrences of each word.
      Parameters:
      emailBody - The email body as a string. It should be non-null and can include punctuation or mixed case.
      Returns:
      A map where the keys are unique words (in lowercase, with punctuation removed), and the values are the frequency of each word in the email body.

    • calculateCosineSimilarity

      public static double calculateCosineSimilarity(String emailbody1, String emailbody2)
      Calculates the cosine similarity between two email bodies based on their word frequency maps. Cosine similarity measures the similarity between two texts by comparing the frequency of words in each text, resulting in a value between 0 and 1.
      Parameters:
      emailbody1 - The body of the first email to be compared. It should be a non-null string.
      emailbody2 - The body of the second email to be compared. It should be a non-null string.
      Returns:
      A double value between 0 and 1 representing the cosine similarity. - 1 indicates identical word frequency distributions. - 0 indicates no common words or vectors with zero magnitude.

    • createCosineSimilarityMatrix

      public static double[][] createCosineSimilarityMatrix(List<String> emailBodies)
      Generates a cosine similarity matrix for a list of email bodies. The matrix contains pairwise cosine similarity values for the given email bodies, where each value indicates the similarity between two emails.
      Parameters:
      emailBodies - A list of email body strings to compare. Each string represents the content of an email. The list must not be null, and it can have zero or more email bodies.
      Returns:
      A 2D array (double[][]) representing the cosine similarity matrix. - The matrix is of size n x n, where n is the number of email bodies. - Each cell [i][j] contains the cosine similarity between emailBodies.get(i) and emailBodies.get(j). - Diagonal elements [i][i] will always be 1.0, as each email is perfectly similar to itself.

    • calculateSpamProbabilities

      public static Map<String,Double> calculateSpamProbabilities(List<String> emailBodies)
      Calculates spam probabilities for a list of email bodies based on their cosine similarity. Each email is assigned a spam probability that reflects its similarity to other emails in the list. Higher probabilities indicate greater similarity to other emails, suggesting potential spam.
      Parameters:
      emailBodies - A list of email body strings to analyze for spam probability. - If the list is empty, an empty map is returned. - If the list contains a single email, its spam probability is set to 0.0.
      Returns:
      A map where: - Keys are the email body strings. - Values are the corresponding spam probabilities (as normalized cosine similarity values). - For multiple emails, probabilities are normalized sums of cosine similarities with all other emails.
